intro: Saussurea yubarimontana, commonly known as the Yubarimontan Hawk's-bill, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a dense, compact inflorescence. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
